node.text:
Mr Jonathan Williams, Consul (Head of Political and Communications) from the British Consulate-General in Hong Kong, is another great friend of HKBU, and he joined us yesterday to celebrate Valentine‚Äôs Day.
.
Every year HKBU welcomes over 200 exchange students from all over the world to study here, and British students form one of the largest groups. Mr Williams joined us for a casual and relaxed gathering with exchange students from the UK, and HKBU students who went on exchange to the UK. Big love to the UK!

Mr Kurt Tong, Consul General of the United States to Hong Kong and Macau, recently came to HKBU for Renri, the 7th day of the first month in the traditional Chinese calendar. Celebrating the special day with HKBU students, which according to Chinese customs marks the day human beings were created, Mr Tong also met with US students currently studying at HKBU, as well as HKBU students who recently returned from their exchange in the US.

Do you want to know how many solar panels can be installed on your building? How much electricity will they generate annually? How much do they cost and how much will they save? Hong Kong Solar Map helps Hong Kong residents answer all these questions and many more!
.
Hong Kong Solar Map was developed through a collaboration between Hong Kong Baptist University, WWF-HK, and Greenpeace. The map is the first of its kind in the Greater China region.
.
http://digital.lib.hkbu.edu.hk/solarmap/

Mr Aaron Kwok Fu-shing, a renowned film actor had presented the Distinguished Award to Mr Liu Kai-Chi, Lecturer of the Academy of Film (AF) in recognition of his exemplary contributions to the programme in the 10th Anniversary Gala Screening on 25 January 2019 to celebrate a decade of success for the Higher Diploma in Creative Film Production programme offered by AF.

Founded in 2009, the Higher Diploma in Creative Film Production programme has made great efforts to equip the young generation with the professional skills and knowledge for entering into the film, TV or creative media industries. The programme has nurtured numerous aspiring directors, actors, and film-related talents. 
For further details about the programme, please visit http://af.hkbu.edu.hk/en/hd-introduction
